header.heading: Elixir
header.subHeading: Full stack web development with NodeJS

overview.content:
Web Development course is designed to help students develop professional websites/portals. This course will help students understand how the web engine works. Through this course, students will be made comfortable with java script for both Front end as well as back end use-cases
Elixir is a project based web development Full Stack course with backend in Node.JS. In this course, students will start building their website from scratch and will need to think like professional developers. Students will be aligned with a mentor and work on their web development projects under their guidance. Elixir enables students to go live with their websites and add a flair to their resume.

courseHighlights.title: UI Design
courseHighlights.content: An app with great functionality must be complemented by top notch User Experience and a neat User Interface. We teach building both common and upcoming UI/UX patterns.

courseHighlights.title: Firebase & Push Notifications
courseHighlights.content: Firebase is Google's service that provides a realtime database and push notifications, so that you can send information to the user even when he is not using your app

courseHighlights.title: Hardware Sensors
courseHighlights.content: Sensors help us build context-aware apps. You'll learn how to use GPS location, orientation, speed sensors, and perform actions on events like flip and shake

courseHighlights.title: Network & Databases
courseHighlights.content: Most apps are connected in nature. You'll learn how to connected your apps to a backend to create an ecosystem of users and their data

courseContents.title: HTML/CSS
courseContents.description: The building blocks of web pages – HTML and CSS. Learn how to use the latest HTML5 web development technologies along with CSS3 stylesheets to create amazing and responsive web sites that catch the eye of the viewer. We will also cover UI design patterns  like –
points: Media Queries and Mobile Responsive Design

courseContents.title: Javascript
courseContents.description: HTML and CSS brings the content and design together, while Javascript is at the heart of all action. Learn to act on events like ‘clicks’, ‘hovers’ and ‘drag and drop’. Javascript is one of the most powerful and ubiquitious languages in modern software development, and we will cover the innards of Javascript in depth including –
points: Lexical Scopes, Arrow Functions and Variable spreading

courseContents.title: UNIX AND Git
courseContents.description: Before we move on to backend development, we will briefly touch upon usage of Unix based systems. More than 80% of the world’s servers are hosted on Linux machines, and any web backend developer has to learn basic DevOps and SysAdmin skills to manage a Linux OS. Also Git, the most commonly used version control system, is one of the most helpful tool required to work on large projects or in collaborative environments

courseContents.title: NODEJS
courseContents.description: Javascript is not just only on the frontend, but a potent force on the server too. Built by Ryan Dahl in 2009 as a platform to run JS code on bare metal, NodeJS is right now the fastest growing ecosystem. We will learn –
points: ExpressJS Framework for creating REST APIs
Handlebars for server side web rendering

courseContents.title: Advanced Data Structures & Algorithms
courseContents.contentTitle: Heaps, Hash Tables, Graphs, Tries, Dynamic Programming
courseContents.description: In this final classes of our course, we will learn about more complex data structures and algorithms which help you in solving and optimising solutions of lots of problems.

faqs.ans: Anybody who is interested in learning C++ programming can do this course. C++ is a powerful language and is pretty easy to learn. Coding in its most essential form is nothing but problem solving. It deals with figuring out logical solutions and implementing them optimally. The process of learning to code transforms a person into an analytical thinker with strong mathematical and logical skills.

faqs.ques: Will this course help if I have C++ in class 12th?
faqs.ans: Yes, absolutely. There is a lot more to learn in C++ than the school curriculum. School syllabus just scratches the surface of C++ programming and doesn’t cover most of the Data Structures, which will be covered in this course in great detail.

faqs.ques: I didn’t have C++ in class 12 ? Can I do this course ?
faqs.ans: Yes. Our instructors will start the C++ course from beginner's level. You don’t need any prior programming knowledge to attend this course. What we need is dedication and passion to learn programming from your side.

faqs.ques: Will this help me with competitive programming or can I apply to ACM-ICPC after doing this course?
faqs.ans: This course will help you become smarter with your solutions. You’ll be able to write solutions that run in lesser space and time. The last time we heard from capable competitive programmers, they said these skills made them capable.

faqs.ques: Will this course help me in Interviews?
faqs.ans: Yes, absolutely. Our course is designed in such a way it covers from fundamentals to advanced topics. Many frequently asked Interview questions will be done in the class and in assignments. We will have special interview talks by industry experts from reputed companies.
